intro: Ptilotus longistachyus, commonly known as the long-stalked spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiky, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to red in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. Ptilotus longistachyus is well adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
